(a) a {@item dungeoneer's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

fluff.name: The Sorcerer
entries: 苍白的半精灵低声念着咒语，他的影子突然活了过来，化为一只巨大的狼。影子野兽扑向那个胆敢攻击他的愚蠢土匪，并将其压倒在地。苍白的巫师又念了一道咒语，手中凝聚出脉动的奥术酸球。土匪发出一声充满悔恨的尖叫，挣扎着试图摆脱巫师的活影。尖叫声成为他的绝命之音，一股魔法召唤的酸液浪潮溶解了他的肉体和骨骼，化为一滩粘液。
当草地和树木被巨龙的烈焰吞噬时，烟雾散去，显现出一个年轻的人类男子。他的衣服被烧焦，露出身体上金色鳞片的斑块。他的眼睛闪烁着金色的光芒，白色的火焰从他的指尖迸发而出。巨龙被这意想不到的冲击震撼，当它从天空坠落时，这个有鳞的野兽想知道这个可怜的凡人是如何获得与真龙不相上下的力量的。
年轻的半身人女孩闪进一条小巷，把偷来的面包藏在斗篷下。她刚离开的市场已经陷入混乱。她试图使用简单的魔法，只是想说服一个面包师傅免费给她一条面包，但她的魔法有了其他打算。当她低声念咒时，市场上响起了像闪电一样的裂响，瞬间市场广场上的所有农产品都腐烂了。她闪进附近的小巷，咒骂着那股狂野的力量，这股力量让她被家人抛弃。
以上三个角色都是巫师; 他们是活生生的奥术力量之源。与其他法师不同，他们与自己的魔法合为一体，可以将其塑造成强大的效果。

entries.name: Magic Made Manifest
entries: 无论是天生具有内在奥术潜能的人，还是被强大实体赋予巫术能力，巫师们本质上都是魔法潜能的化身。巫师在凡人中是罕见的存在，他们的内在力量常常使他们成为众人关注的焦点。然而，这种力量也有其弊端，当不加利用时，它会寻找机会泄露到世界中。
通常，术士内在的魔法是驱使他们冒险的动力。有些人寻找其他也拥有这些力量的人，而另一些人则希望掌握自己天生的能力。

entries.name: Innate Arcane Power
entries: 魔法是任何术士生活中不可或缺的一部分，渗透在他们的身体、心灵和灵魂中。对于一些人来说，这种力量是从携带着强大生物魔法的血统中继承而来的。其他人则会随机地表现出他们的力量，让它以意想不到的方式迸发出来。力量的显现是不可预测的，一些血统每代会产生一个术士，而在其他血统中，每个后代都有术士的潜力。
无论他们的起源如何，术士对巫师的咒语书或牧师或术士的赞助毫无用处。他们是自己的魔法能量源泉，并学会引导这种力量来制造奇迹般的魔法壮举。

entries.name: Creating Your Sorcerer
entries: 在创建你的术士(Sorcerer)时，最重要的问题是考虑你的力量来源。作为一个起始角色，你需要从职业描述中详细的选项中选择一个术士的起源(Sorcerous Origin)，但你的力量确切来源由你决定。它是家族的诅咒，从遥远的祖先传承给你的吗？还是一些非同寻常的事件让你被赋予了内在的魔法，但也许同时留下了伤痕？

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: 你可以按照以下建议快速创建一个巫师。首先，将魅力设为你最高的能力值，其次是体质。其次，选择{@background hermit}背景。第三，选择{@spell firebolt}，{@spell light}，{@spell prestidigitation}，和{@spell shocking grasp}这些零级咒语，以及{@spell shield}和{@spell magic missile}这两个法术。

classFeature.name: Sorcerous Origin
entries: 你体内注入了一种与奥术魔法相联系的天赋火花。在1级时，选择以下其中一种巫术起源来获得你的力量：炎心(Emberheart)、石血(Stoneblood)、风暴之魂(Stormsoul)或者浪生(Waveborn)，每种起源的详细信息都在本职业描述的末尾。
你的巫术起源在1级时赋予你特性，之后在该职业的6级、14级和18级时再次获得特性。

entries.name: Additional Sorcerous Origins
entries: 在这个职业描述的末尾，包括了来自{@i Player's Handbook}、{@i Xanathar's Guide to Everything}和{@i Tasha's Cauldron of Everything}的官方巫术起源的备选选项。
在《扩展术士：备选》中还可以找到九种额外的术士起源，包括仙灵、邪恶、皇家、亡灵和武术选项。

classFeature.name: Sorcery
entries: 在1级时，你体内的奥术魔法火花使你能够自发地施放出法术。这个类别的末尾包括{@filter Sorcerer spell list|spells|class=Alternate Sorcerer (LLAS)}。

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: 在1级时，你可以从术士法术列表中选择四个法术零级咒语。在4级时，你可以再选择一个额外的术士法术零级咒语，然后在10级时再选择一个。

entries.name: Sorcery Points
entries: 术士表格显示了你用来施展你所知道的1级及更高级别术士法术所需的法术点数。要施展一个术士法术，你必须消耗表格中指示的法术点数。每次你完成一次长休后，你会恢复所有已消耗的法术点数。
例如，作为一名3级巫师，你可以通过花费3点法术点数，在2级时使用{@spell burning hands}这个法术。

entries.name: Spell Limit
entries: 你的巫师等级限制了你可以施展的法术的强度。这一限制体现在巫师表格的法术限制列中。例如，作为5级巫师，你只能学习和施展3级或更低级别的法术。

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st-level and Higher
entries: 在1级时，你可以从术士法术清单中选择两个1级法术。请参考术士表中的"已知法术"栏，以了解何时学习额外的术士法术。你学习的每个法术的等级必须等于或低于你的法术等级限制。例如，当你达到3级时，你可以学习一个新的1级或2级术士法术。
此外，当你在这个职业中升级时，你可以选择你已经掌握的巫师法术中的一个，并用巫师法术清单中另一个法术替换它，新法术的等级必须等于或低于你的法术上限等级。

entries.name: Origin Spells
entries: 每个巫术起源都有一个起源法术列表，你在起源描述中指定的巫师等级时学会这些法术。你的起源法术算作巫师法术，但它们不计入你已知法术的总数。

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: 魅力是你作为巫师法术的施法能力，因此当一个法术提到你的施法能力、设定法术豁免 DC，或进行你的巫师法术之一的法术攻击检定时，你会使用魅力值。

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: 你的身体本身可以用作施法焦点。在施放需要手势或物质成分的法术时，你必须至少有一只空手，并且仍需提供被法术消耗或有金币成本的物质成分。

classFeature.name: Metamagic
entries: 你可以借助与奥术的亲密联系，以只有术士才能做到的方式操纵魔法。在2级时，你可以从本职业描述末尾的"变形魔法列表"中选择两种元术能力。除非描述另有说明，否则每次施法、反应、能力检定或豁免才能只能使用一种元术能力。
随着你获得巫师等级，你将获得额外的变形魔法能力，如巫师表中的已知变形魔法列所示。当你获得一个巫师等级时，你可以改变你的魔法本质，并用你选择的另一个变形魔法能力替换你已知的一个变形魔法能力。

classFeature.name: Arcane Regeneration
entries: 你已经学会了利用万物中固有的魔法存在来恢复自己的奥术能量。从3级开始，当你完成一个短休息时，你可以选择恢复消耗的(%num%)巫师等级的法术点。
使用这个特性来恢复法术点后，你必须完成一次长休才能再次使用它。

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: 当你达到四级时，你可以将你选择的一项能力得分提高2分，或者将你选择的两项能力得分提高1分。
如果你的DM允许使用功法，你可以改用（%0%）。

classFeature.name: Sorcerous Origin Feature
entries: 在6级时，你获得一个由你的巫术起源赋予的特性。

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: 当你达到8级时，你可以将你选择的一项能力得分提高2分，或者将你选择的两项能力得分提高1分。
如果你的DM允许使用功法，你可以改用（%0%）。

classFeature.name: Font of Magic
entries: 从10级开始，你可以利用与奥术的内在联系施放你不熟悉的法术。每次长休一次，你可以施放一个你选择的巫师法术，等同于你的法术上限或更低，消耗正常数量的巫术点数。你可以像平常一样对这个法术应用你的元术能力。

classFeature.name: Innate Arcanum (6th-level)
entries: 在11级时，你从你的奥术火花中显现出更强大的力量，被称为内在奥秘(`Innate Arcanum`)。这个奥秘以一个6级法术位的形式存在，你可以消耗它，代替法术点(`Sorcery Points`)，施放你已知的任何术士法术。一旦你消耗了这个法术位，直到你完成一次长休(`long rest`)之前都不会恢复。
此外，在你的回合中作为一个奖励动作，你可以消耗一个内在奥秘法术位来恢复与该奥秘法术位等级相等的一定数量的术法点数。
最后，每当你学习一个新的术士法术时，你可以学习与你固有奥术(%num%)等级相同的法术。
当你达到一定的巫师等级时，你独特的魔法会表现出更强大的内在奥秘。在13级时，你获得一个7级法术位，在15级时，你获得一个8级法术位，在17级时，你获得一个9级法术位。

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: 当你达到12级时，你可以将你选择的一项能力得分提高2分，或者将你选择的两项能力得分提高1分。
如果你的DM允许使用功法，你可以改用（%0%）。

classFeature.name: Innate Arcanum (7th-level)
entries: 在13级时，你从你的奥术火花中显现出更强大的力量，被称为内在奥秘 (`Innate Arcanum`)。这个奥秘以一个单独的7级法术位的形式呈现，你可以消耗它，代替法术点数，施放你所知道的任何术士法术。一旦你消耗了这个法术位，你在完成一次长休前都不会恢复它。

classFeature.name: Sorcerous Origin Feature
entries: 在14级时，你获得一个由你的巫术起源所赋予的特性。

classFeature.name: Innate Arcanum (8th-level)
entries: 在15级时，你从你的奥术火花中显现出更强大的力量，被称为内在奥秘（Innate Arcanum）。这个奥秘化为一个单独的8级法术位，你可以消耗它来施放你已知的任何术士法术，而不是使用法术点。一旦你消耗了这个法术位，直到你完成一次长休息之前都不会恢复它。

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: 当你达到16级时，你可以将你选择的一项能力得分提高2分，或者将你选择的两项能力得分提高1分。
如果你的DM允许使用功法，你可以改用（%0%）。

classFeature.name: Innate Arcanum (9th-level)
entries: 在17级时，你从你的奥术火花中显现出更强大的力量，被称为内在奥秘(`Innate Arcanum`)。这个奥秘以一个单独的9级法术位的形式出现，你可以消耗它，代替源术点，施放你所知道的任何术士法术。一旦你消耗了这个法术位，你在完成一次长休息之前不会恢复它。

classFeature.name: Sorcerous Origin Feature
entries: 在18级时，你获得一个由你的巫术起源所赋予的特性。

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: 当你达到19级时，你可以将你选择的一项能力得分提高2分，或者将你选择的两项能力得分提高1分。
如果你的DM允许使用功法，你可以改用（%0%）。

classFeature.name: Metamagic Mastery
entries: 你已经意识到了你内在魔法的全部潜力，魔网本身也随你的意志弯曲。达到20级时，你所掌握的每个元术能力的法术点成本减少1点（最低为1点法术点）。
此外，您可以对您施放的每个法术应用无限数量的元术能力，前提是您有足够的法术点数，并且您施放的法术符合您希望应用的元术能力的所有要求。

subclassFeature.name: Alternate Aberrant Mind
entries: 一股外星影响已经将其触须缠绕在你的思维周围，赋予你灵能力量。你现在可以用这种力量触及其他思维，并通过控制多元宇宙的魔法能量来改变周围的世界。这种力量会从你身上闪耀出来，成为给予他人希望的灯塔吗？还是你将成为那些感受到你思维刺痛并目睹你力量奇异表现的人的恐怖源泉？
作为一名异常心灵术士，你可以决定自己是如何获得力量的。你是天生具备这些力量的吗？还是后来发生的某个事件让你充满了异能意识？请参考异常起源表，了解你力量的可能起源。

entries.caption: Aberrant Origins
rows: 你受到了远域扭曲影响。你坚信自己身上正在长出一根触手，但其他人却看不到它。
来自灵界的一股心灵风将超能能量传递给了你。当你使用你的能力时，你周围会闪烁着微弱的光点。
你曾经遭受过一只阿波莱斯（aboleth）的支配力量，留下了一个心灵裂片在你的脑海中。
你被植入了一颗触须怪幼虫，但融合过程从未完成。现在它的超能力属于你。当你使用它时，你的肉体会闪耀着一种奇怪的黏液。
在你小时候，你有一个看起来像(`Flumph`)或者奇怪的鸭嘴兽一样的虚构朋友。有一天，它赋予了你超能力，这些超能力最终变得并不那么虚构。
你的噩梦向你低语着真相：你的超能力并非源自你自己。你是从你的寄生胞胎那里汲取力量的！

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Aberrant Mind feature}
当你达到该职业的特定等级时，你将学会额外的法术，如超能法术表所示。这些法术中的每一个对你来说都算作巫师法术，但不计入你已知的巫师法术数量。

每当你获得一个术士等级时，你可以用另一个相同等级的法术替换你从这个特性获得的一个法术。新的法术必须是一个{@filter divination or an enchantment spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|class=sorcerer;warlock;wizard|school=D;E|level=1;2;3;4;5}。

entries.caption: Psionic Spells
rows: {@spell arms of Hadar}, {@spell dissonant whispers}, {@spell mind sliver|tce}

subclassFeature.name: Telepathic Speech
entries: {@i 1st-level Aberrant Mind feature}
你可以在你的心灵和另一个生物的心灵之间建立一种感应连接。作为一个奖励动作，选择一个你能看到的距离你30英尺以内的生物。只要你和被选择的生物在彼此之间的距离不超过你的魅力调整值（最小为1英里），你们两个就可以在心灵上进行交流。为了相互理解，你们每个人必须用对方懂的语言进行心灵交流。
心灵感应连接持续时间为你的术士等级数量的分钟。如果你是{@condition incapacitated}，或者死亡，或者使用这个能力与另一个生物建立连接，连接会提前结束。

subclassFeature.name: Psionic Sorcery
entries: {@i 6th-level Aberrant Mind feature}
你学会了微妙法术变形(Metamagic)，但它不计入你已知的变形法术数量。你可以将微妙法术应用于一个智力法术，而不消耗法术点数，次数等于你的魅力调整值。当你完成一次长休时，你恢复所有已用次数。

subclassFeature.name: Psychic Defenses
entries: {@i 6th-level Aberrant Mind feature}
你获得对精神伤害的抗性，并且在豁免抗性上对于被施加 {@condition charmed} 或 {@condition frightened} 时获得优势。

subclassFeature.name: Revelation in Flesh
entries: {@i 14th-level Aberrant Mind feature}
你可以释放你内心隐藏的异常真相。作为一个奖励动作，你可以消耗2个或更多的巫术点来改变你的身体，持续10分钟。每消耗2个巫术点，你可以选择以下一个效果，其效果持续到变身结束：

items: 你可以看见你周围60英尺内的任何生物，只要它没有被完全遮挡。你的眼睛也会变黑，或者变成扭曲的感知触须。
你获得一个与你步行速度相同的飞行速度，并且可以悬停。当你飞行时，你的皮肤会闪闪发光，或者散发出异世界的光芒。
你获得一个游泳速度，等于你步行速度的两倍，并且你可以在水下呼吸。此外，鳃会从你的脖子生长出来，或者从耳后扇出，你的手指会变得有蹼，或者你会长出蠕动的纤毛，延伸穿过你的衣服。
你的身体，连同你所穿戴或携带的任何装备，都变得粘稠而柔韧。你可以在任何狭窄到1英寸的空间里移动而不被挤压，你可以花5英尺的移动距离来摆脱非魔法的束缚或被动（%0%）。

subclassFeature.name: Warp Reality
entries: {@i 18th-level Aberrant Mind feature}

你可以释放你的异常力量，作为一个空间扭曲的异常体。作为一个动作，你可以传送到你能看到的距离120英尺内的一个未被占据的空间。在你消失后，每个在你离开的空间30英尺范围内的生物必须根据你的法术豁免 DC 进行一次力量豁免检定。未通过豁免的生物会受到 {@damage 3d10} 点力量伤害，并被拉向你离开的空间，最终停在一个尽可能靠近你原来位置的未被占据的空间。通过豁免的生物只会受到一半伤害且不会被拉向。
一旦你使用这个特性，除非你消耗7点法术点，否则在完成一次长休之前无法再次使用。

subclassFeature.name: Alternate Clockwork Soul
entries: 宇宙秩序的力量已经注入你的魔法之中。这股力量源自于机械位面或类似的位面-一个完全由钟表般高效率塑造的存在平面。你或者你的祖先可能已经卷入了摩德隆（Modron）的阴谋中，这些有序的生物居住在机械位面。也许你的祖先甚至参与了伟大的摩德隆行军（Great Modron March）。无论这股力量在你内心的起源如何，秩序之力对于其他人来说可能看起来很奇怪，但对于你来说，它是一个庞大而辉煌的系统的一部分。

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Magic
entries: {@i 1st-level Clockwork Soul feature}
当你达到这个职业的特定等级时，你将学会额外的法术，如时钟法术表所示。这些法术中的每一个对你来说都算作一个术士法术，但不计入你所知道的术士法术数量。

每当你获得一个术士等级时，你可以用与该等级相同的一个法术替换你从这个特性获得的一个法术。新的法术必须是一个{@filter abjuration or a transmutation spell from the sorcerer, warlock, or wizard spell list|spells|class=sorcerer;warlock;wizard|school=A;T|level=1;2;3;4;5}。

entries.caption: Clockwork Spells
rows: {@spell alarm}, {@spell protection from evil and good}

entries: 此外，请参考《秩序表现》表格，并选择或随机确定一种方式，当你施放任何巫师法术时，你与秩序的联系会如何显现。

entries.caption: Manifestations of Order
rows: 你身后悬浮着幽灵齿轮。
时钟的指针在你眼中旋转。
你的皮肤闪着一种黄铜般的光泽。
数学方程式和几何物体浮在你的身体上。
你的施法焦点暂时变成了一个微型发条机械。
你和受到你魔法影响的人都能听到齿轮的滴答声或时钟的钟声。

subclassFeature.name: Restore Balance
entries: {@i 1st-level Clockwork Soul feature}
你与绝对秩序位面的联系使你能够平衡混乱的时刻。当你能看见的一只生物即将进行一次带有优势或劣势的{@dice d20}骰时，你可以使用你的反应来防止该骰受到优势和劣势的影响。
你可以使用这个特性的次数等于你的熟练加值，当你完成一次长休后，你会恢复所有已用次数。

subclassFeature.name: Bastion of Law
entries: {@i 6th-level Clockwork Soul feature}
作为一个动作，你可以消耗1到7点巫术点来在你自己或者你能看到的距离30英尺内的另一个生物周围创造一个魔法结界。该结界持续直到你完成一次长休，或者直到你使用此特性来创建另一个结界。
护盾由{@dice d6}个骰子代表，数量等同于用于创建护盾的巫术点数。当受到伤害时，被保护的生物可以消耗其中一些骰子，投掷它们，并将投掷的数字减少所受到的伤害。

subclassFeature.name: Trance of Order
entries: {@i 14th-level Clockwork Soul feature}
你获得了将意识与机械位面（Mechanus）无尽计算对齐的能力。作为一个奖励动作，你可以进入这种状态持续1分钟。在持续时间内，对你的攻击卷轴不能从优势中获益，每当你进行攻击卷轴、技能检定或豁免检定时，你可以将{@dice d20}上的9或更低点数视为10。
一旦你使用了这个奖励动作，除非你消耗了7个法术点，否则在完成一次长休息之前不能再次使用它。

subclassFeature.name: Clockwork Cavalcade
entries: {@i 18th-level Clockwork Soul feature}
你召唤秩序之灵来清除你周围的混乱。作为一个动作，你在以你为中心的一个30英尺立方体中召唤这些灵体。这些灵体看起来像莫德龙或者你选择的其他构造体。这些灵体是无形且无敌的，在消失前在立方体内产生以下效果：

items: 灵魂恢复多达100点生命值，可分配给你选择的立方体中任意数量的生物。
任何完全位于立方体内的受损物体都会立即修复。
在立方体中，你可以选择结束所有6级或更低级法术对生物和物体的影响。

entries: 一旦你使用这个动作，除非你花费7个术法点再次使用，否则你必须完成一次长休才能再次使用。

subclassFeature.name: Alternate Divine Soul
entries: 有时，激发巫师的魔法火花来自灵魂深处闪耀的神圣源泉。拥有这样一个受祝福的灵魂，表明你与生俱来的魔力可能来自于与一个神圣存在的遥远但强大的家族联系。也许你的祖先是个天使，变成了凡人，被派去以神的名义战斗。
或者你的出生可能与一个古老的预言一致，标志着你是神的仆人或神圣魔法的选定容器。
神圣的灵魂，具有天然的磁性，被一些宗教等级制度视为一种威胁。作为一个拥有神圣权力的局外人，神灵可以通过宣称与神灵的直接联系来破坏现有的秩序。
在一些文化中，只有那些能够宣称拥有神圣灵魂力量的人可以掌握宗教权力。在这些地方，教会职位由少数血统主导，并世代保存。

subclassFeature.name: Divine Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Divine Soul feature}
学习巫师法术时，你也可以从{@filter Cleric spell list|spells|class=cleric}中进行选择，它将成为你的巫师法术。
当你获得一个术士等级时，你可以用另一个(牧师)法术替换这个特性中的一个法术。

entries.caption: Divine Spells
rows: {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell guiding bolt}
{@spell dispel evil and good}, {@spell greater restoration}

subclassFeature.name: Favored by the Gods
entries: {@i 1st-level Divine Soul feature}
从第一层开始，神圣的力量守护着你的命运。如果你的救赎失败或攻击卷失误，你可以滚动（%0%）并将其加入总数，可能会改变结果。一旦你使用了这个功能，你就不能再使用它，直到你完成一个短期或长期休息。

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Healing
entries: {@i 6th-level Divine Soul feature}
从6级开始，流淌在你身上的神力可以赋予治疗法术以力量。每当你或你5英尺内的盟友掷骰子决定一个法术所恢复的命中率时，你可以花1个巫术点重新掷一次任何数量的骰子，只要你不是（%0%）。你每回合只能使用这个功能一次。

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Wings
entries: {@i 14th-level Divine Soul feature}
从14级开始，你可以使用一个额外的动作，从你的背后显现出一对幽灵之翼。当翅膀存在时，你的飞行速度为30英尺。翅膀持续到你（%0%），你死亡，或者你用额外行动解除它们。
你为你的神术特征选择的亲和力决定了幽灵之翼的外观：鹰翼代表善或法律，蝙蝠翼代表恶或混乱，蜻蜓翼代表中立性。

subclassFeature.name: Unearthly Recovery
entries: {@i 18th-level Divine Soul feature}
18级时，你获得了克服重伤的能力。当你剩余的命中率低于一半时，作为一个额外的动作，你可以重新获得相当于你最大命中率一半的命中率。
一旦你使用这个功能，你就不能再使用它，直到你完成长时间的休息。

subclassFeature.name: Alternate Draconic Bloodline
entries: 你的先天魔法来自与你或你祖先的血液混合的龙族魔法。大多数情况下，拥有这种血统的巫师会追溯到古代某个与龙达成交易的强大巫师，或者甚至可能声称自己有龙的父母。这些血统中有些在这个世界上很有地位，但大多数是不明显的。任何一个巫师都可能是一个新血统的第一人，这是一个契约或其他一些特殊情况的结果。

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Ancestor
entries: {@i 1st-level Draconic Bloodine feature}
一级时，你选择一种龙作为你的祖先。与每个龙相关的伤害类型被你以后获得的特性所使用。
你可以说、读、写{@language Draconic}。此外，当你与龙交互时进行魅力检定时，如果适用于该检定，你的熟练加值翻倍。

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Resilience
entries: {@i 1st-level Draconic Bloodine feature}
当魔法流经你的身体时，它会使你的龙祖先的身体特征显现出来。在1级时，你的最大命中率增加1，并且每当你在这个等级中获得一个等级时，又增加1。
此外，你的部分皮肤被一层薄薄的龙形鳞片所覆盖。当你不穿盔甲时，你的攻击力等于13+你的灵巧修正值。

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Draconic Bloodine feature}
当你在这个职业中升级时，你可以用另一个与你的龙族血统伤害相同等级的法术替换这个特性中的一个法术，该法术可以来自任何法术清单。

subclassFeature.name: Elemental Sorcery
entries: {@i 6th-level Draconic Bloodine feature}

每当你施放一项与你龙神血统对应的伤害类型的术士法术时，你可以在该法术的一个伤害骰中加上你的魅力调整值（最低为+1）。此外，你学会了{@optfeature Elemental Spell|LaserLlamaAlternateSorcerer}元术，但这不会计入你已知元术的数量。你可以使用这个元术而不消耗法术点数，只要你将其伤害改为你龙神血统的伤害类型。如果你的龙神血统是紫水晶、水晶、翡翠或黄玉，你将学会奥秘法术。

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Wings
entries: {@i 14th-level Draconic Bloodine feature}
在14级时，你获得了从你的背部长出一对龙翼的能力，获得与你当前速度相等的飞行速度。你可以在你的回合中以奖励行动的方式创造这些翅膀。它们一直持续到你在你的回合中以额外行动的方式将它们解散。
你不能在穿戴盔甲时显现你的翅膀，除非盔甲是为适应它们而制作的，而不是为适应你的翅膀而制作的衣服在你显现它们时可能会被破坏。

subclassFeature.name: Draconic Presence
entries: {@i 18th-level Draconic Bloodine feature}
作为一个动作，你可以花费5个法术点来散发出龙的光环，影响60英尺半径内的生物，选择敬畏或恐惧效果。在接下来的一分钟内，那些在光环内开始他们的回合的生物必须进行一次感知豁免检定，否则会受到{@condition charmed}（敬畏）或{@condition frightened}（恐惧）效果，直到光环结束。如果豁免成功，生物对这个光环在24小时内免疫。

subclassFeature.name: Alternate Shadow Magic
entries: 你是一个影子的生物，因为你与生俱来的魔法来自于影子城本身。你可能会追溯到你与那个地方的一个实体的血缘关系，或者你可能暴露在它的堕落能量中并被它转化。
影子魔法的力量在你的身体上投下了一个奇怪的阴影。支撑你的生命之火被压制住了，就好像它在挣扎着要保持生命力来对抗灌输给你灵魂的黑暗能量。根据你的选择，你可以从影子巫师的怪癖表中挑选或滚动，为你的角色创造一个怪癖。

entries.caption: Shadow Sorcerer Quirks
rows: 当你睡着时，你似乎没有呼吸（尽管你仍然必须呼吸才能生存）。
你几乎不流血，即使受重伤也是如此。
你的心脏每分钟跳动一次。这一事件有时会让你感到惊讶。
你很难记住，活物和尸体应该被区别对待。
你眨了眨眼。一次。上个星期。

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Shadow Magic feature}

当你在这个职业中获得一个等级时，你可以用{@filter illusion or necromancy spell from the Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard spell list of the same level|spells|class=sorcerer;warlock;wizard|school=I;N|level=1;2;3;4;5}替换这个特性中的一个法术。

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of the Dark
entries: {@i 1st-level Shadow Magic feature}
从1级开始，你拥有射程为120英尺的{@sense darkvision}。
当你在这个职业中达到3级时，你会学会{@spell darkness}法术，这个法术不计入你作为巫师所知道的法术数量。此外，你可以通过花费2点法术点来施放{@spell darkness}，当你这样做时，你可以看穿你制造的黑暗。

subclassFeature.name: Strength of the Grave
entries: {@i 1st-level Shadow Magic feature}
从1级开始，你在生与死之间的黄昏状态的存在使你难以被打败。当伤害使你的生命值降至0时，你可以做一个魅力救赎（DC5+所受伤害）。如果成功，你会下降到1点生命值。如果你被辐射伤害或关键一击降低到0点，你就不能使用这一特性。
救赎成功后，你不能再使用这个功能，直到你完成一个长时间的休息。

subclassFeature.name: Hound of Ill Omen
entries: {@i 6th-level Shadow Magic feature}
在6级时，你获得了召唤黑暗嚎叫生物来骚扰你的敌人的能力。在你的回合中作为一个奖励动作，你可以消耗5点法术点并召唤一只不祥之犬，以目标是你能看到的120英尺内的一名生物。这只犬使用{@creature dire wolf}的属性（请参阅《怪物手册》或玩家手册附录C），但有以下变化：

items: 这只猎犬的体型为中等（Medium），而不是大型（Large），它被视为畸变生物（monstrosity），而不是野兽（beast）。
你获得一些临时生命值，数量等同于你术士等级的一半。
它可以像穿过{@quickref difficult terrain||3}一样穿过其他生物和物体。如果猎犬在物体内结束其回合，它会受到5点力场伤害。
在它的回合开始时，猎犬自动知道目标的位置。如果目标曾经隐藏过，那么对于猎犬来说，目标不再隐藏。

entries: 猎犬出现在您选择的目标附近30英尺内的空地上。为猎犬投掷先攻骰。在它的回合中，它只能沿着最直接的路径朝着目标移动，并且它只能使用动作来攻击目标。猎犬可以进行机会攻击，但只能针对目标。此外，当猎犬距离目标在5英尺内时，目标在你施放的任何法术的豁免投掷上有劣势。如果猎犬被降为0点生命值，如果它的目标被降为0点生命值，或者经过5分钟后，猎犬会消失。

subclassFeature.name: Shadow Walk
entries: {@i 14th-level Shadow Magic feature}
在14级时，你获得了从一个影子步入另一个影子的能力。当你在昏暗的光线或黑暗中时，作为一个额外的动作，你可以神奇地传送到一个你能看到的、同样处于昏暗光线或黑暗中的无人空间，最远可达120英尺。

subclassFeature.name: Umbral Form
entries: {@i 18th-level Shadow Magic feature}
从18级开始，你可以花费6个法术点作为一个奖励动作，将自己魔法地转变成一个阴影形态。在这种形态下，你对所有伤害具有抗性，除了力量和辐射伤害，你可以如同它们是{@quickref difficult terrain||3}一样穿过其他生物和物体。如果你在一个物体内结束你的回合，你会受到5点力量伤害。
你在这种形态下保持1分钟。如果你是{@condition incapacitated}，如果你死亡，或者如果你把它作为一个额外的行动来解除，它就会提前结束。

subclassFeature.name: Alternate Wild Magic
entries: 你与生俱来的魔法来自创世秩序背后的狂野混乱力量。你可能曾经接触过某种形式的原始魔法，也许是通过一个通往地狱、元素界或神秘的远界的平面门户。也许你被一个强大的费伊生物所祝福，或者被一个恶魔所标记。或者你的魔法可能是你出生时的一种侥幸，没有明显的原因或理由。不管它是怎么来的，这种混乱的魔力在你体内汹涌澎湃，等待着任何出口。

subclassFeature.name: Wild Magic Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Wild Magic feature}

当你在这个职业中升级时，你可以用{@filter evocation or transmutation spell from the Sorcerer or Wizard spell list of the same level|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|class=wizard;alternate sorcerer (llas)|school=v;t}替换这个特性中的一个法术。

subclassFeature.name: Wild Magic Surge
entries: {@i 1st-level Wild Magic feature}

Starting when you choose this origin at 1st level, your spellcasting can unleash surges of untamed magic. Immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher, the DM can have you roll a {@dice d20}. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a random magical effect. A Wild Magic Surge can happen once per turn.

If a Wild Magic effect is a spell, it's too wild to be affected by Metamagic. If it normally requires {@status concentration}, it doesn't require {@status concentration} in this case; the spell lasts for its full duration.

entries.caption: Wild Magic Surge
rows: Roll on this table at the start of each of your turns for the next minute, ignoring this result on subsequent rolls.
For the next minute, you can see any {@condition invisible} creature if you have line of sight to it.
A {@filter modron|bestiary|source=mm|search=modron} chosen and controlled by the DM appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You cast {@spell fireball} as a 3rd-level spell centered on yourself.
You cast {@spell magic missile} as a 5th-level spell.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your height changes by a number of inches equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you shrink. If the roll is even, you grow.
You cast {@spell confusion} centered on yourself.
For the next minute, you regain 5 hit points at the start of each of your turns.
You grow a long beard made of feathers that remains until you sneeze, at which point the feathers explode out from your face.
You cast {@spell grease} centered on yourself.
Creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against the next spell you cast in the next minute that involves a saving throw.
Your skin turns a vibrant shade of blue. A {@spell remove curse} spell can end this effect.
An eye appears on your forehead for the next minute. During that time, you have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.
For the next minute, all your spells with a casting time of 1 action have a casting time of 1 bonus action.
You teleport up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see.
You are transported to the Astral Plane until the end of your next turn, after which time you return to the space you previously occupied or the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.
Maximize the damage of the next damaging spell you cast within the next minute.
Roll a {@dice d10}. Your age changes by a number of years equal to the roll. If the roll is odd, you get younger (minimum 1 year old). If the roll is even, you get older.
{@dice 1d6} {@creature flumph||flumphs} controlled by the DM appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of you and are {@condition frightened} of you. They vanish after 1 minute.

You turn into a potted plant until the start of your next turn. While a plant, you are {@condition incapacitated} and have vulnerability to all damage. If you drop to 0 hit points, your pot breaks, and your form reverts.
For the next minute, you can teleport up to 20 feet as a bonus action on each of your turns.
A {@creature unicorn} controlled by the DM appears in a space within 5 feet of you, then disappears 1 minute later.
You can't speak for the next minute. Whenever you try, pink bubbles float out of your mouth.
A spectral shield hovers near you for the next minute, granting you a +2 bonus to AC and immunity to {@spell magic missile}.
You are immune to being intoxicated by alcohol for the next {@dice 5d6} days.
Your hair falls out but grows back within 24 hours.
For the next minute, any flammable object you touch that isn't being worn or carried by another creature bursts into flame.
You regain your lowest-level expended spell slot.
For the next minute, you must shout when you speak.
You cast {@spell fog cloud} centered on yourself.
Up to three creatures you choose within 30 feet of you take {@damage 4d10} lightning damage.
You are {@condition frightened} by the nearest creature until the end of your next turn.
Each creature within 30 feet of you becomes {@condition invisible} for the next minute. The invisibility ends on a creature when it attacks or casts a spell.
You gain resistance to all damage for the next minute.
A random creature within 60 feet of you becomes {@condition poisoned} for {@dice 1d4} hours.
You glow with bright light in a 30-foot radius for the next minute. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet of you is {@condition blinded} until the end of its next turn.
You cast {@spell polymorph} on yourself. If you fail the saving throw, you turn into a sheep for the spell's duration.
Illusory butterflies and flower petals flutter in the air within 10 feet of you for the next minute.
You can take one additional action immediately.
Each creature within 30 feet of you takes {@damage 1d10} necrotic damage. You regain hit points equal to the sum of the necrotic damage dealt.
You cast {@spell fly} on a random creature within 60 feet of you.
You become {@condition invisible} for the next minute. During that time, other creatures can't hear you. The invisibility ends if you attack or cast a spell.
If you die within the next minute, you immediately come back to life as if by the {@spell reincarnate} spell.
Your size increases by one size category for the next minute.
You and all creatures within 30 feet of you gain vulnerability to piercing damage for the next minute.
You are surrounded by faint, ethereal music for the next minute.
You regain all expended sorcery points.

subclassFeature.name: Tides of Chaos
entries: {@i 1st-level Wild Magic feature}
从第一层开始，你可以操纵机会和混乱的力量，在一次攻击卷、能力检查或蓄力上获得优势。一旦你这样做了，你必须完成一个长时间的休息才能再次使用这个功能。

Any time before you regain the use of this feature, the DM can have you roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table immediately after you cast a sorcerer spell of 1st level or higher. You then regain the use of this feature.

subclassFeature.name: Bend Luck
entries: {@i 6th-level Wild Magic feature}
从6级开始，你有能力用你的野性魔法来扭曲命运。当另一个你能看到的生物进行攻击卷、能力检查或蓄力投掷时，你可以使用你的反应并花费2个巫术点来进行滚动（%0%），并将所滚动的数字作为奖励或惩罚（你选择）应用于该生物的滚动。你可以在生物滚动后，但在滚动的任何效果发生前这样做。

subclassFeature.name: Wild Sorcery
entries: {@i 6th-level Wild Magic feature}

You learn the {@optfeature Unstable Spell|LaserLlamaAlternateSorcerer} Metamagic, but it does not count against your total number of Metamagics Known. Moreover, for you, it only costs 1 Sorcery Point to use.

subclassFeature.name: Controlled Chaos
entries: {@i 14th-level Wild Magic feature}
At 14th level, you gain a modicum of control over the surges of your wild magic. Whenever you roll on the {@table Wild Magic Surge|PHB} table, you can roll twice and use either number.

subclassFeature.name: Spell Bombardment
entries: {@i 18th-level Wild Magic feature}
从18级开始，你的法术的有害能量会加强。当你为一个法术掷出伤害并在任何一个骰子上掷出可能的最高数字时，选择其中一个骰子，再次掷出，并将该骰子加入伤害中。你每回合只能使用该功能一次。

subclassFeature.name: Emberheart
entries: Whether you stole your power from a noble Efreeti lord, were gifted it by an ancient fire drake, or were born near a gate to the Elemental Plane of Fire, you now carry within your soul an ember of pure elemental flame. This ember of arcane fire fuels your burning soul, inflames your passions, and allows you to perform wondrous and terrible feats of fire magic.

subclassFeature.name: Emberheart Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Emberheart feature}

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one spell from this feature with another spell of your choice of the same level, {@filter that deals only fire damage, from any spell list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|damage type=!acid;!bludgeoning;!cold;fire;!force;!lightning;!necrotic;!piercing;!poison;!psychic;!radiant;!slashing;!thunder}.

entries.caption: Emberheart Spells
rows: {@spell summon elemental|tce|summon elemental (fire)}, {@spell wall of fire}

subclassFeature.name: Heart of Flame
entries: {@i 1st-level Emberheart feature}
Primordial flame empowers your spirit. You gain resistance to fire damage and you have advantage on saving throws to resist the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.
You also learn to speak, read, and write {@language Primordial||Ignan}, a dialect of {@language Primordial}, and the language of the Elemental Plane of Fire.

subclassFeature.name: Wild Fire
entries: {@i 6th-level Emberheart feature}

You can cause fire to erupt from the ruin of your foes. When you reduce a creature to 0 hit points with a spell that deals fire damage, you can use your reaction to force creatures within 10 feet of it to make Dexterity saving throw. They take fire damage based on the size of the creature, as shown in the table below, on a failed save, and half as much on a success.
You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses of this reaction when you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Kindle the Flame
entries: {@i 14th-level Emberheart feature}

Your body is restored when you draw on the elemental flame. Whenever you cast a fire spell of 1st-level or higher, you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to the level the fire spell was cast at + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Inferno
entries: {@i 18th-level Emberheart feature}
Your flaming soul has become an inferno, making you more elemental than mortal. You no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep, and you gain immunity to fire damage.
Also, when you take damage from a creature within 60 feet, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw as a reaction. On a failure, it takes fire damage equal to your level.

subclassFeature.name: Stoneblood
entries: You are a Stoneblood Sorcerer, a mortal imbued with a shard of pure elemental earth who can access the powerful magics of rock and stone. Whether this power was given to you by a Dao warlord, the gift of an elder earth elemental, or you are a direct descendant of one of the ancient Dwarven fathers, you now wield the unyielding power of stone. Your magic makes you as rigid and unyielding as the mountains, and can subtly drive you to hoard precious gems and metals of the earth.

subclassFeature.name: Stoneblood Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Stoneblood feature}

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one spell from this feature with another spell of the same level, {@filter that deals only bludgeoning damage, from any spell list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|damage type=!acid;bludgeoning;!cold;!fire;!force;!lightning;!necrotic;!piercing;!poison;!psychic;!radiant;!slashing;!thunder}.

entries.caption: Stoneblood Spells
rows: {@spell maximilian's earthen grasp|xge|earthen grasp}, {@spell spike growth}
{@spell steel wind strike|xge}, {@spell wall of stone}

subclassFeature.name: Heart of Earth
entries: {@i 1st-level Stoneblood feature}
You can use a bonus action on your turn to transform and take on an earthen form, encasing your body in elemental stone. While transformed, you gain the following benefits:

items: Upon transforming, you gain temporary hit points equal to your Sorcerer level. Any temporary hit points remaining from this feature dispel at the end of your transformation.
If you are not wearing any armor or wielding a shield, your Armor Class becomes 13 + your Constitution modifier.
You can use your Constitution, in place of Strength, for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes.
Your unarmed strikes deal {@damage 1d8} bludgeoning damage on hit. If you strike with two hands, the {@damage d8} becomes a {@damage d10}.

entries: Your transformation lasts for 1 minute, and it ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated} or you use a bonus action to end it.

You can transform in this way a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all of your expended uses when you finish a long rest. If you have no uses of this feature left, you can expend 3 Sorcery Points to transform again. Finally, you learn to speak, read, and write {@language Primordial||Terran}, one dialect of {@language Primordial} and the language of the Elemental Plane of Earth.

subclassFeature.name: Crushing Blow
entries: {@i 6th-level Stoneblood feature}

You can empower your strikes with the force of elemental stone. When you hit a creature with an unarmed strike, you can expend Sorcery Points (up to your Spell Limit) to deal an additional {@damage 1d6} magical bludgeoning damage to the target for each Sorcery Point you spent.
In addition, while you are transformed into earthen form, your unarmed strikes count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistances and immunities to non-magical attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 6th-level Stoneblood feature}
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast a Sorcerer cantrip you know in place of one of the attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Aegis of Stone
entries: {@i 14th-level Stoneblood feature}

You can ward others with elemental earth magic. As a bonus action, you can expend 3 Sorcery Points to ward yourself, or a creature you touch, with an Aegis of Stone for 1 minute. While this Aegis lasts, the creature is resistant to all non-magical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

When a creature warded by your Aegis of Stone is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to teleport to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the attacker and make one melee attack against it. You can only teleport in this way if you and the attacker are on the same surface.
Only one creature can benefit from your Aegis of Stone at a time. Warding another creature dispels the previous Aegis.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Bulwark
entries: {@i 18th-level Stoneblood feature}
Your stalwart stone soul has made you more elemental than mortal. You no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep, and you are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
In addition, you can have up to three creatures under the effects of your Aegis of Stone at one time.

subclassFeature.name: Stormsoul
entries: Within you dwells a mote of pure elemental air, which grants you innate power over both breeze and storm. Whatever the origin of your power, your inner primal storm can drive you from whimsical and calm, to violence with little warning. Do you embrace the winds or do you seek to control the storm?

subclassFeature.name: Heart of Winds
entries: {@i 1st-level Stormsoul feature}

Drawing upon the tempestuous magic within you allows you to take flight. When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed, which lasts until the end of your current turn. This flight doesn't provoke opportunity attacks, but If you end your movement while you are in midair you fall to the ground at the end of your turn.
You also learn to speak, read, and write {@language Primordial||Auran}, a dialect of {@language Primordial}, and the language of the Elemental Plane of Air.

subclassFeature.name: Stormsoul Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Stormsoul feature}

When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one spell from this feature with another spell of the same level, {@filter that deals only lightning or thunder damage, from any spell list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|damage type=!acid;!bludgeoning;!cold;!fire;!force;lightning;!necrotic;!piercing;!poison;!psychic;!radiant;!slashing;thunder}.

subclassFeature.name: Stormborn
entries: {@i 6th-level Stormsoul feature}
The tempest within your soul defends you and threatens your foes. You gain resistance to lightning and thunder damage.

As a bonus action, you can expend Sorcery Points (up to your Spell Limit) to force creatures of your choice within 10 feet to make a Dexterity saving throw. They take {@damage 1d6} lighting or thunder damage (your choice) per Sorcery Point expended on a failed save, half as much on a successful save.

Finally, you can use an action on your turn to control the weather in minor ways within a 100-foot radius of you. For example, you could stop the rain, cause it to rain, change the current direction of the wind, or stop the wind completely.

subclassFeature.name: Windcaller
entries: {@i 14th-level Stormsoul feature}
You bend the wind itself to your will. You gain a flying speed of 60 feet, and learn {@spell wind walk}, which counts as a Sorcerer spell for you, but doesn't count against your Spells Known.
While flying your lower half becomes a swirling tempest.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Storm
entries: {@i 18th-level Stormsoul feature}
Your tempestuous soul has made you more elemental than mortal. You no longer need to eat, drink, or sleep, and you gain immunity to both lightning and thunder damage.

Also when a creature you can see within 60 feet damages you, you can use your reaction to force it to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, it takes thunder damage equal to your Sorcerer level and is knocked back 20 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Waveborn
entries: Within you dwells a drop of pure elemental water, connecting you to the waters of the deepest oceans, babbling brooks, and frozen lakes. The gentle lapping of waves, the spray of the sea foam on the wind, the crushing darkness of the ocean depths; all these call you. Your watery magic can be as refreshing as the rains, or as destructive as great waves and flood waters.

subclassFeature.name: Heart of Water
entries: {@i 1st-level Waveborn feature}

The droplet of elemental water within your soul has altered your physical form. You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed, you can breathe both air and water, and you can see underwater as if you were in bright light.
You also learn to speak, read, and write {@language Primordial||Aquan}, a dialect of {@language Primordial}, and a language of the Elemental Plane of Water.

subclassFeature.name: Waveborn Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Waveborn feature}

Whenever you gain a level in this class, you can replace one spell from this feature with another spell of your choice of the same level, {@filter that deals only cold damage, from any spell list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|damage type=!acid;!bludgeoning;cold;!fire;!force;!lightning;!necrotic;!piercing;!poison;!psychic;!radiant;!slashing;!thunder}.

subclassFeature.name: Frozen Curse
entries: {@i 1st-level Waveborn feature}

Your watery magic carries a frozen curse. When you deal cold damage with a Sorcerer spell, you can spend additional Sorcery Points to cover targets in frost (1 target per Sorcery Point), reducing their speeds by a number of feet equal to five times your Charisma modifier (minimum of 5 feet).
This reduction to a target's speed lasts until the beginning of your next turn, unless the cursed creature, or another creature uses an action to scrape the frost off one of the targets.

subclassFeature.name: Oceanic Resilience
entries: {@i 6th-level Waveborn feature}

You are as resilient as water, able to flow and reform. As a reaction when you are hit by an attack, you can flow like water, gaining resistance to any bludgeoning, cold, piercing, or slashing damage from that attack, and can instantly move up to your full speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. When you have no uses left, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Watery Form
entries: {@i 14th-level Waveborn feature}

Whenever you take the {@action Dash} action, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to take on a Watery Form until the end of your current turn. While in this Watery Form, you can move through gaps as narrow as 1 inch, including the spaces of enemy creatures, and you gain resistance to damage from opportunity attacks.
In addition, if you are using your swimming speed, you can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Primordial Deluge
entries: {@i 18th-level Waveborn feature}
Your watery soul has transformed your physical form, making you more elemental than mortal. You no longer need to drink, eat, or sleep, and you gain immunity to cold damage.
Moreover, you are always considered to be in your Watery Form, unless you choose not to be, and you gain resistance to all bludgeoning, cold, piercing, and slashing damage.
Finally, when you use your Oceanic Resilience reaction, you gain immunity to all instances of bludgeoning, piercing, slashing, and cold damage from the triggering attack.

subclassFeature.name: The Chained
entries: Once you were an unknowable, all powerful, and far reaching otherworldly entity, but now... now you are but shade of your former self, bound in mortal flesh. The eldritch essence from which you draw your magic is all that remains of your ancient terrible power. Maybe one day you will be able to regain your true power and punish those who did this to you...

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level The Chained feature}

The fragment of your former power grants you dark magic. When you learn a Sorcerer spell, you can choose from the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}, and it becomes a Sorcerer spell for you.
When you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one spell from this feature with another Warlock spell of your choice.

entries.caption: Spells
rows: {@spell arms of hadar}, {@spell tasha's hideous laughter||hideous laughter}
{@spell arcane eye}, {@spell evard's black tentacles||black tentacles}

subclassFeature.name: Ancient Knowledge
entries: {@i 1st-level The Chained feature}

You have access to lost knowledge from eons long dead. You gain proficiency in {@skill History}, and you learn to speak, read, and write, {@filter two exotic languages|languages|type=exotic} of your choice.

Also, while you sleep during a long rest, you can commune with the ancient knowledge you once had, focusing your mind on one person, place, or object you interacted with in the past 24 hours. Make a Charisma ({@skill History}) check to learn one fact about the subject, often one forgotten to modern scholars.

subclassFeature.name: Unknowable Mind
entries: {@i 6th-level The Chained feature}
Your elder mind grants you advantage on saving throws to resist being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, or have your thoughts read.

Additionally, when you are forced to make an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw to resist the effects of a spell, you can use your reaction to force a creature within 30 feet to become the target of the spell instead of you.
Once you use this reaction you must complete a long rest before you can use it again. If you have no uses of this feature remaining, you can spend 5 Sorcery Points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Step
entries: {@i 14th-level The Chained feature}

You can draw on your eldritch power to move through cracks in reality. When you spend Sorcery Points, you can teleport a number of feet equal to 5 times the number of Sorcery Points you spent, appearing in an unoccupied space within range.

subclassFeature.name: Eldritch Revelation
entries: {@i 18th-level The Chained feature}
As an action, you can spend 7 Sorcery Points to assume your former power. For 1 minute, you gain the benefits below:

items: You can cast {@spell tasha's hideous laughter||hideous laughter} at 1st-level spell as a bonus action on each turn, without expending Sorcery Points.
You gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

You can move through other creatures and objects. If you end your movement inside an object or creature, you are shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, and take {@damage 1d10} force damage for every 5 feet you were forced to travel.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Right
entries: Once in a generation, a divinely chosen ruler is born amongst the people. Some cults and countries seek out these blessed rulers, trusting the gods to select their leader. However, the existence of these chosen Sorcerers can pose a significant threat to those currently in power. While some will willingly step aside to let the will of the gods rule, other less honorable leaders will hunt down these challengers to their power.
As a Divine Right Sorcerer, you are granted great power, but with that power also comes responsibility. Will you lead the your people to destruction or into a new golden age?

subclassFeature.name: Divine Mark
entries: {@i 1st-level Divine Right feature}

A Divine Mark has manifested somewhere on your body signifying the type of ruler you are to become. Select one of the Divine Marks below. Once chosen, your Mark can't be changed short of the {@spell wish} spell or divine intervention.

entries.name: Mark of Elegance
entries: You will be known for diplomacy. You gain proficiency in {@skill Persuasion}, and you add double your proficiency bonus to Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks.

entries.name: Mark of Guile
entries: You will be known for your cunning. You gain proficiency in {@skill Deception}, and you can add double your proficiency bonus to all Charisma ({@skill Deception}) checks.

entries.name: Mark of Might
entries: You will be known for your strength. You gain proficiency in {@skill Intimidation}, and you add double your proficiency bonus to all Charisma ({@skill Intimidation}) checks.

subclassFeature.name: Royal Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Divine Right feature}

When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one spell from this feature with a {@filter conjuration or enchantment spell of the same level from the Cleric, Sorcerer, or Wizard spell list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|class=wizard;cleric;alternate sorcerer (llas)|school=c;e}.

subclassFeature.name: Words of Authority
entries: {@i 1st-level Divine Right feature}

Your voice has been imbued with divine authority, and it is difficult for the weak willed to resist your commands. When you target a creature that can hear you within 5 feet with an enchantment spell, you can force the creature to make its initial saving throw to resist the spell with disadvantage.

Once you use this feature to impose disadvantage, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. When you have no uses of this feature remaining, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Words of Vigor
entries: {@i 6th-level Divine Right feature}

The power of your voice uplifts those that choose to follow you. As a bonus action, you can spend a number of Sorcery Points, up to your Charisma modifier and grant one creature that can hear you within 30 feet {@dice 1d4} temporary hit points per Sorcery Point expended.

subclassFeature.name: Regal Presence
entries: {@i 14th-level Divine Right feature}

Your divine presence inspires confidence in your followers. When a creature that can see or hear you within 60 feet is forced to make a saving throw you can use your reaction to grant that creature advantage on its roll.
Also, the range of Words of Authority becomes 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Command
entries: {@i 18th-level Divine Right feature}

You have risen to become a legendary figure of authority for your people, and your voice is blessed with increased divine power. As a bonus action on your turn, you can cast the {@spell divine word} spell without expending Sorcery Points.
Once you cast {@spell divine word} in this way you must finish a long rest before you can use it again. When you have no uses remaining, you can spend 10 Sorcery Points to cast it again.

subclassFeature.name: Faeblood
entries: Every so often, a mortal catches the attention of a lord or lady of the Fey. Often, the object of affection or offspring of this relationship is gifted wondrous arcane ability beyond that of other mortals. However, these mortal infatuations are usually brief, and the mortals are left to learn to use their power with little supervision or instruction. Weather you were chosen by a powerful Fey, or were the child of such a relationship or you have been blessed with the whimsical power of the Feywild.

subclassFeature.name: Fey Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Faeblood feature}
When you learn a Sorcerer spell, you can also choose from the {@filter Bard spell list|spells|class=bard}, and it becomes a Sorcerer spell for you.
When you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one spell from this feature with another Bard spell of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Heartsight
entries: {@i 1st-level Faeblood feature}
Your affinity with Fey magic grants you heightened empathic abilities. You gain proficiency in {@skill Insight}, and you add double your proficiency bonus to your Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) checks.

In addition, you can use an action to touch a creature and attempt to read its current emotional state. Make a Wisdom ({@skill Insight}) check, contested by its Charisma ({@skill Deception}) check. On a success, you learn the target's alignment and its surface level emotions. Celestials, fiends, and undead automatically fail. Creatures are unaware you attempted to read their heart.

subclassFeature.name: Seasonal Attunement
entries: {@i 6th-level Faeblood feature}

You can align your magic and spirit with one of the seasons like a true Fey. At the end of each long rest, choose a season and gain the benefits listed below. Each season grants you a damage resistance and advantage on certain rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Gateway Magic
entries: {@i 14th-level Faeblood feature}

Your magic allows you to slip between the Feywild and the material plane. Whenever you cast a Sorcerer spell of 1st-level or higher, can teleport to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 30 feet.
When you use this feature, you can spend Sorcery Points to increase its range by 10 feet per Sorcery Point spent.

subclassFeature.name: Intoxicating Presence
entries: {@i 18th-level Faeblood feature}

You exude the intoxicating presence of an Archfey. When you cast a Sorcerer Enchantment spell and target a creature that is within 15 feet that can see or hear you, the target has disadvantage on its initial saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Greensinger
entries: There are many reclusive sages who learn to wield the magic of nature, but a rare few are born with an innate connection to that magic. Known as Greensingers, these wild sorcerers are able to magically manipulate plants, and can even sprout vines from their flesh in order to move about the world. How did you come to bear this primal power? Were you chosen by an ancient forest to serve as its guardian, or are you the child of an ancient prophecy, raised from birth by a Druidic Circle?

subclassFeature.name: Verdant Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Greensinger feature}
When you learn a Sorcerer spell, you can also choose from the {@filter Druid spell list|spells|class=druid}, and it becomes a Sorcerer spell for you.
When you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one spell from this feature with another Druid spell of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Vigorous Vines
entries: {@i 1st-level Greensinger feature}

As a bonus action, you can to extrude (or retract) a thin, yet vigorous, vine from any part of your your body up to 10 feet in length. You can use this vine to perform simple tasks, but it can't be used to attack, manipulate tools, or activate items, and it cannot carry more than 10 pounds.
These Vigorous Vines share your Armor Class and have a number of hit points equal to your Sorcerer level. If you extrude a second Vine, the first instantly withers and dies.
As you gain Sorcerer levels, you can extrude more Vines at one time: at 5th level (2), 11th level (3), and 17th level (4).

subclassFeature.name: Grasping Growth
entries: {@i 6th-level Greensinger feature}

Your Vigorous Vines can grow up to 15 feet in length. While your vines are extruded, you can use a bonus action to attempt to {@action grapple} a creature within 5 feet of a Vine, making a Charisma ({@skill Athletics}) check.

Also, while you have at least two Vines extruded, you gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed, and you can climb on difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

entries.name: Grappling from a Distance
entries: Remember, a creature {@condition grappled} by you, no matter how far from your body, is able to attack whatever limb, or Vigorous Vine, you are using to grapple it.

subclassFeature.name: Creeping Defense
entries: {@i 14th-level Greensinger feature}
Each of your Vigorous Vines can grow up to 20 feet in length.

In addition, when you are hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to block the incoming blow with one of your Vines. If the incoming damage would destroy your Vine, you take any damage that would exceed your vine's remaining hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Sapping Grip
entries: {@i 14th-level Greensinger feature}

At the start of your turn, each creature {@condition grappled} by one of your Vines takes necrotic damage equal to your Charisma modifier, and you gain temporary hit points equal to the total necrotic damage dealt to all {@condition grappled} creatures.

subclassFeature.name: Greensong
entries: {@i 18th-level Greensinger feature}

You and the natural world have become one. You can use an action to enter the Greensong, a state of pure harmony with nature. For the next minute, or until you are {@condition incapacitated}, you gain the benefits listed below:

items: You immediately extrude the maximum number of Vines.
The reach of your Vines temporarily becomes 30 feet.

When you take the {@action Attack} action, you can make an attack, or attempt a {@action grapple} with each Vine. You use Charisma for the attack rolls, and they deal magical bludgeoning damage equal to {@damage 1d8} + your Charisma modifier on hit.

entries: Once you enter the Greensong you must finish a short or long rest before you can do so again. When you have no uses left, you can spend 5 Sorcery Points to use this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Hellspawn
entries: Most mortals who wield the fiendish power of the hells do so through strict contracts with devils and Archdevils. However, some cultists and other mortals connect with more chaotic demonic powers and become Hellspawn. Though not always evil, Hellspawn are fueled by the chaotic magic of the Abyss.

subclassFeature.name: Abyssal Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Hellspawn feature}

Whenever you gain a Sorcerer level, you can replace one spell from this feature with another {@filter conjuration or evocation spell of the same level from either the Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard spell list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|class=wizard;warlock;alternate sorcerer (llas)|school=c;v}.

subclassFeature.name: Demonic Form
entries: {@i 1st-level Hellspawn feature}

As a bonus action, you can unleash your infernal power to transform into a Demonic Form. While you are transformed your body becomes demonic in appearance and you gain the benefits listed below for one minute:

items: Your hands become wicked natural weapons that deal 1d8 slashing damage on hit, and you can use your Charisma, in place of Strength, for their attack and damage rolls.
While you aren't wearing armor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier.
As a bonus action, you can grant yourself temporary hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1).

entries: Your transformation ends early if you are {@condition incapacitated}, or you end it as a bonus action. You can transform a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. If you have no uses of your Demonic Form transformation left, you can spend 3 Sorcery Points to transform again.
Additionally, you learn to speak, read, and write {@language Abyssal}, the language of demons and all creatures of the Abyss.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 6th-level Hellspawn feature}
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your Sorcerer cantrips in place of one of those attacks.
Finally, while you are in your Demonic Form, your natural weapon attacks count as magical for the sake of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Fiendish Resistance
entries: {@i 14th-level Hellspawn feature}

Your hellish power can shield you from harm. As a reaction, when you take damage while in your Demonic Form, you can expend Sorcery Points to reduce the incoming damage by 2 for each Sorcery Point you expend as part of the reaction.

subclassFeature.name: Archdemonic Form
entries: {@i 18th-level Hellspawn feature}
You have mastered the fiendish power that dwells within you. Your Demonic Form lasts until you end it. Also, while you are in Demonic Form, you gain the following additional benefits:

items: You can take the {@action Dash} action as a bonus action.
You are immune to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical attacks.
When you hit a creature with a natural weapon attack it takes an additional {@damage 1d8} magical slashing damage.

subclassFeature.name: Ironmonger
entries: Often born during times of great war and strife, Ironmonger Sorcerers have an affinity for all things forged for use in war. They thrive in the midst of battle, wielding potent war magic on the front lines. Ironmongers are formidable foes, and are sought after by captains and conquerers for their ability to turn the tide of any battle, no matter how hopeless.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Ironmonger feature}

Whenever you gain a level, you can replace one spell from this feature with another {@filter abjuration or conjuration spell of the same level from the Sorcerer or Wizard spell list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|class=wizard;alternate sorcerer (llas)|school=a;c}.

subclassFeature.name: Armaments of War
entries: {@i 1st-level Ironmonger feature}

The arcane power within your soul grants you an affinity with the armaments of war. You gain proficiency with all light and medium armor, shields, and all {@filter simple and martial weapons that lack the heavy or two-handed properties|items|source==b0~b0|type=!futuristic;martial weapon;!modern;!renaissance;simple weapon;!treasure|rarity=none|property=!heavy;!two-handed}.

subclassFeature.name: Blade of Strife
entries: {@i 1st-level Ironmonger feature}

You can conjure up the signature weapon of an Ironmonger Sorcerer, the Blade of Strife. As a bonus action, you conjure this mystical Blade at a point you can see within 60 feet. It lasts for 1 minute or until you use this feature again.

When you conjure the Blade, you can make a melee spell attack against one creature within 10 feet of it. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} magical slashing damage. As a bonus action, you can move the Blade up to 30 feet and repeat the attack.

You can conjure this Blade a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), and you regain all of your expended uses when you finish a long rest. You can only have one Blade at a time, and conjuring a second causes the first Blade to dispel. Finally, if you have no uses of this feature remaining, you can spend 3 Sorcery Points to use it again.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 6th-level Ironmonger feature}
You can attack twice, instead of once, when you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn. Moreover, you can cast one of your Sorcerer cantrips in place of one of those attacks.
Finally, when your Blade of Strife is within 10 feet of you, you can make attacks with it as part of your {@action Attack} action.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Smite
entries: {@i 6th-level Ironmonger feature}
Once per turn when you hit a Large or smaller creature with a melee weapon or Blade of Strife attack you can force it to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save it falls {@condition prone}.

subclassFeature.name: Dancing Blade
entries: {@i 14th-level Ironmonger feature}
When a creature within 10 feet of your Blade of Strife is hit by an attack, you can use your reaction to add your Charisma modifier to the target's Armor Class against that attack.
Also, your Blade of Strife now deals {@damage 2d8} damage on hit.

subclassFeature.name: Storm of Blades
entries: {@i 18th-level Ironmonger feature}

You have become a god of warfare and lay waste to your foes. As an action on your turn, you can destroy your Blade of Strife in a storm of arcane iron shards, forcing two creatures of your choice within 30 feet of the Blade to make a Dexterity saving throw. Targets take {@damage 6d8} magical slashing damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful save.
When you use this action, you can spend Sorcery Points to target additional creatures, targeting one additional creature of your choice within 30 feet per Sorcery Point you spend.

subclassFeature.name: Vampiric Soul
entries: The dark magic of undeath is a path to great power for those who are willing to pay the price. Many of the most powerful undead creatures will grant their followers a portion of their dark sorcery in return for their service. Evil vampires, long dead mummy lords, and sinister liches have all been known to curse their most loyal followers with sorcerous abilities.
What have you sacrificed to gain this sinister sorcery? Are you sworn in service to a dark lord or a creature of undeath?

entries.name: Optional Rule: True Vampirism
entries: Vampires and other sinister masters of necrotic magic are some of the most iconic monsters, but their vampiric power comes at significant cost.
If you choose to play as a {@i true vampire}, you gain {@b all} of the additional abilities listed below when you take your 1st level as a Vampiric Soul Sorcerer.

entries.name: Deathless Nature
entries: You no longer need to breathe, eat, or drink in order to survive.

entries.name: Spider Climb
entries: You gain a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. Beginning at 3rd level, you can use this climbing speed to move across vertical surfaces, including upside down, while leaving your hands free, without having to make an ability check.

entries.name: Superior Darkvision
entries: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, you can only see shades of gray.

entries.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of the attack, or whatever you are trying to see is in direct sunlight.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Magic
entries: {@i 1st-level Vampiric Soul feature}

ou have been gifted an affinity for blood magic. Whenever you cast a Sorcerer spell or use a Sorcerer class feature, you can expend your own hit points in place of Sorcery Points by expending two hit points for each Sorcery Point you would have spent. When you do so, your current and your maximum hit points are reduced by the number of hit points you spend. This hit point reduction cannot be lessened in any way. Any reduction to your maximum hit points from this feature lasts until the end of your next long rest, at which point it returns to normal.

Moreover, when you slay a creature with a Sorcerer spell of 1st-level or higher, you gain temporary hit points equal to the level at which the spell was cast. Any temporary hit points you gain from this feature can be used in place of your current hit points (but not your maximum hit points) for your Blood Magic spellcasting.

subclassFeature.name: Vampiric Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Vampiric Soul feature}

When you gain a level in this class, you can replace a spell from this feature with a {@filter necromancy or enchantment spell, of the same level from the Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|class=wizard;warlock;alternate sorcerer (llas)|school=e;n}.

subclassFeature.name: Undead Resilience
entries: {@i 6th-level Vampiric Soul feature}
You gain resistance to both necrotic and poison damage, and you have advantage on saves to resist the {@condition poisoned} condition.
Also, when you have temporary hit points from your Blood Magic feature, you gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from non-magical, non-silvered, attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Misty Escape
entries: {@i 14th-level Vampiric Soul feature}
As a reaction to when you are reduced to 0 hit points, but not killed outright, you can turn into a cloud of mist, reappearing with 1 hit point in an unoccupied space within 30 feet.
Once you use this reaction you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. When you have no uses left, you can spend 5 Sorcery Points to use this reaction again.

subclassFeature.name: Vampiric Mastery
entries: {@i 18th-level Vampiric Soul feature}

You have mastered the sinister blood magic within your soul. When you deal necrotic damage to a target with a Sorcerer spell of 1st-level or higher, you gain temporary hit points equal to half the necrotic damage.
These temporary hit points can also be used in place of your current hit points for your Blood Magic Spellcasting.

subclassFeature.name: Voidwielder
entries: Before the primordial gods formed the world, there was only the Void. This formless, lightless, writhing chaos desires that all creation should return to it. Voidwielders are Sorcerers who wield the entropic power of the Void, working to undo the very acts of creation. They are often nihilistic in their outlook on life, resigned to the fact that all will eventually dissolve into the nothingness of the great primordial Void.

subclassFeature.name: Voidwielder Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Voidwielder feature}

Whenever you gain a level, you can replace one spell from this feature with another {@filter abjuration or necromancy spell of the same level from the Sorcerer, Warlock, or Wizard list|spells|level=1;2;3;4;5|class=wizard;warlock;alternate sorcerer (llas)|school=a;n}.

subclassFeature.name: Soul of the Void
entries: {@i 1st-level Voidwielder feature}
Your innate connection to the primordial void grants you the ability to speak, read, and write {@language Primordial}.

subclassFeature.name: Entropic Touch
entries: {@i 1st-level Voidwielder feature}

You can channel the power of the void and send one Tiny or smaller object that you touch into the Void. The item must be non-magical in nature, and cannot be on object that is being worn or carried by another creature.

It remains in the Void for as long as you concentrate on this ability, as if concentrating on a spell. When you maintain concentration for 1 hour, the object is permanently destroyed. If you break your concentration, the object reappears in an unoccupied space as close as possible to its last location.
You can use this feature once without expending Sorcery Points, and cannot do so again until you finish a long rest unless you expend 3 Sorcery Points to use it again.
The size of the non-magical item you can target with this feature increases as you gain levels in this class: at 6th level (Medium), 11th level (Large), and again 17th level (Huge).

subclassFeature.name: Negate Spell
entries: {@i 6th-level Voidwielder feature}

Your connection to the Void allows you to undo arcane magic. When you cast {@spell counterspell} or {@spell dispel magic} and you need to make a spellcasting ability check to determine the result, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points treat a roll of 9 or lower as a 10.

subclassFeature.name: Disciple of the Void
entries: {@i 14th-level Voidwielder feature}

When you use Entropic Touch, you can send a total number of objects equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) into the Void at one time. Only one object can be maximum size; the rest must be Small. If you use this ability again, you must choose an object to reappear.

subclassFeature.name: Ray of Annihilation
entries: {@i 18th-level Voidwielder feature}

The overwhelming power you draw from the Void allows you to unmake creation itself. You can expend one of your Innate Arcanum spell slots to cast {@spell disintegrate} at the same spell level of the Innate Arcanum spell slot you choose to expend.

optionalfeature.name: Arcane Tenacity
entries: When you make a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration on a spell, you can expend 3 Sorcery Points as a reaction to add your Charisma modifier (minimum of +1) to the result of the saving throw. You can use this reaction after you roll, but before you know if you succeed or fail.

optionalfeature.name: Careful Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces targets to make a saving throw, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to protect a number of creatures equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1). These creatures automatically succeed on their saving throw.

optionalfeature.name: Cerebral Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces an Intelligence or Charisma saving throw, you can spend 3 Sorcery Points and change the spell's saving throw to target the other ability score instead.
This Metamagic only changes the initial saving throw. Any subsequent saving throws target the original ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Distant Spell
entries: When you cast a spell with a range of 5 feet or more, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to double its range. If you use this on a spell with a range of touch, its range becomes 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Dynamic Presence
entries: Choose either {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation}, or {@skill Persuasion}. You gain proficiency in that skill, and when you make an ability check with that skill, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to grant yourself advantage on the roll. If you are already proficient in that skill, you gain proficiency in another skill of your choice.
You can select this Metamagic ability more than once, but you must select a different skill proficiency each time.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to change the spell's damage type to another from the list above.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Spell
entries: After you roll damage for a spell, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to re-roll a number of the damage dice up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) and use the new rolls.
You can use Empowered Spell even if you have already used a different Metamagic during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Esoteric Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals force, necrotic, psychic, or radiant damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to change the damage type of the spell to another from the list above.

optionalfeature.name: Extended Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to double the spell's duration, up to a maximum duration of 24 hours.

optionalfeature.name: Heightened Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a creature to make a saving throw, you can spend 3 Sorcery Points to force one target of the spell to make their initial saving throw with disadvantage. The target makes subsequent saving throws as normal.

optionalfeature.name: Imbuing Touch
entries: As a bonus action, you can touch a nonmagical weapon and spend 1 Sorcery Point to imbue it with a spark of your magic. For the next minute, it counts as magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Immutable Will
entries: When you would fail an Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma saving throw, you can use your reaction to spend 3 Sorcery Points to re-roll your saving throw, potentially turning failure into a success. You must use the result of the new roll.

optionalfeature.name: Kinetic Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a Strength or a Dexterity saving throw, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points and change the spell's saving throw to target the other ability score instead.
This Metamagic only changes the initial saving throw. Any subsequent saving throws target the original ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Guidance
entries: When you fail an ability check, you can use your reaction to spend 2 Sorcery Points to re-roll the {@dice d20}. You must use the new {@dice d20} roll, potentially turning a failure into a success.

optionalfeature.name: Misdirecting Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that originates from you, you can spend 3 Sorcery Points to cause the spell to appear as if it had originated from a point you can see within 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Quickened Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to cast it as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Recycled Spell
entries: When you cast a spell you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to cast it in a way that conserves your arcane power. If the spell deals no damage, misses its target, or otherwise fails to take effect, you can use your reaction to regain half the Sorcery Points you spent to cast this spell (rounded down), including the Sorcery Point you spent on this Metamagic.

optionalfeature.name: Resolute Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a Wisdom or a Constitution saving throw, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points and change the spell's saving throw to target the other ability score instead.
This Metamagic only changes the initial saving throw. Any subsequent saving throws target the original ability score.

optionalfeature.name: Seeking Spell
entries: When you make an attack roll for a spell and miss, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to re-roll the {@dice d20}. You must use the new {@dice d20} roll, potentially turning a missed attack into a hit.
You can use Seeking Spell if you have already used a different Metamagic ability during the casting of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Shielded Spell
entries: When you cast a spell while you are within the area of effect of that spell, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to ignore the effects of that spell for the spell's entire duration.

optionalfeature.name: Silent Spell
entries: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to cast a version of that spell that produces no sound. However, you must still speak the verbal components of the spell aloud as this Metamagic only removes the sound of the spell itself.

optionalfeature.name: Sorcerous Fortitude
entries: As an action, you can spend a number of Sorcery Points, up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), to grant yourself {@dice 1d4} temporary hit points per Sorcery Point you spend.

optionalfeature.name: Sturdy Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that requires your concentration, you can spend Sorcery Points, up to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1), to empower your focus. For each Sorcery Point you spend, you gain a +1 bonus to the first saving throw you make to maintain your concentration on that spell.

optionalfeature.name: Subtle Spell
entries: When you cast a spell, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to cast it without providing any of the somatic or verbal components.

optionalfeature.name: Twinned Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that is incapable of hitting more than one target at the level at which you are casting it and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend Sorcery Points equal to the level you cast the spell (1 Sorcery Point for cantrips) to target a second target within the range of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Unerring Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that requires an attack roll or a Dexterity saving throw, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to ignore the effects of half and three-quarters cover.

optionalfeature.name: Unstable Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that forces a target to make a saving throw, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to have the initial saving throw target an ability score determined by random chance. Roll a {@dice d12}, and the spell's initial saving throw is changed to target the ability score from the list below.
If you roll a 1, your spell immediately fails. However, only the 2 Sorcery Points you spent to use this ability are wasted. You regain any Sorcery Points you used to cast the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Adamant Spell
entries: When you cast a spell, you can spend Sorcery Points equal to 1 + the level of the spell to make it immune to anti-magic spells like {@spell counterspell}, {@spell dispel magic}, or {@spell antimagic field}.

optionalfeature.name: Adjacent Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that requires you to make a ranged spell attack while there is an enemy creature within 5 feet of you, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to make your ranged spell attack without the normal disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Blinding Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals fire or radiant damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to force one target of the spell to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is {@condition blinded} for one minute. It can repeat the saving throw at the start of each of its turns, ending the effect on a successful save.

optionalfeature.name: Brutal Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to empower the casting. If you roll the highest number of any of the spell's damage dice you can roll that die again and add it to the total damage. However, if you roll the lowest number on any of the spell's damage dice, you remove that die, and its damage, from the total damage of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Concussive Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals bludgeoning or thunder damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to force one target of the spell to make a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it is knocked {@condition prone}. Creatures that are Large or larger have advantage on the Strength saving throw to resist the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Cantrip
entries: When you cast a Sorcerer cantrip you can expend 1 Sorcery Point to increase the power of that cantrip to its next level.

For example, a 3rd level sorcerer, can spend 1 Sorcery Point to cast {@spell firebolt} as if they were a 5th level sorcerer, and that {@spell firebolt} will deal {@damage 2d10} fire damage in place of {@damage 1d10}.

optionalfeature.name: Imbued Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that has a range of self, you can spend Sorcery Points equal to 1 + the level of the spell to instead cast it with a range of touch, targeting a willing creature.
If the spell requires concentration, the creature you cast the spell on must concentrate on the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Linked Spell
entries: When you cast a spell, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points and touch a willing creature within 5 feet, expending one of its spell slots to cast the spell in place of your Sorcery Points.

optionalfeature.name: Overcharged Spell
entries: When you cast a spell has only one target, and requires you to make a ranged spell attack roll, you can spend 2 Sorcery Points to increase the critical hit range of that spell, allowing you to score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the {@dice d20}.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to have the spell to ignore a single target's resistances to the damage of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Savage Spell
entries: When you cast a spell that deals bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, you can spend 1 Sorcery Point to change the spell's damage type to another from the list above.

feat.name: Alternate Metamagic Adept
entries: You have practiced and learned to manipulate your magic in strange and unique ways. You gain the benefits listed below:

items: You increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You learn one {@filter Metamagic Ability|optionalfeatures|feature type=AS:MM} from those available to the Alternate Sorcerer. You can use this Metamagic Ability once, without expending Sorcery Points, and you regain the ability to do so when you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Sorcerous Spark
entries: While you may not be a true Sorcerer, within you dwells a small spark of arcane power. You gain the benefits below:

items: You learn {@filter one cantrip and two 1st-level spells|spells|level=0;1|class=Alternate Sorcerer (LLAS)} of your choice from the Sorcerer spell list, and Charisma is your spellcasting modifier for all three spells.

You gain two Sorcery Points which you can expend to cast either of the spells that you learned from this Feat, or any other Sorcerer spells you know. If you already have Sorcery Points, these are added to your existing pool of Sorcery Points. You regain your Sorcery Points each time you finish a long rest.

spell.name: Arcane Lance
entries: You conjure a lance of pure arcane energy in your hand, and make a ranged spell attack against a creature you can see within range. On hit, the target takes {@damage 5d4} force damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d4} for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Torrent
entries: A burst of elemental water erupts from you in a line 30 feet long and 5 feet wide in a direction you choose, forcing any creature in that area to make a Strength saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes {@damage 1d12} cold damage, is knocked back 10 feet in a straight line, and falls {@condition prone}. A creature that is Large, or larger, has advantage on its saving throw.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d12} and it knocks back targets an additional 10 feet for each slot level above 1st.

spell.name: Aura of Frost
entries: Arcane frost, snow, and wind swirl about you in an aura with a 10-foot radius, and until the spell ends, the aura moves with you, centered on you. When a creature other than you enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@damage 2d8} cold damage and its speed is reduced by 20 feet until the start of its next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much cold damage and its speed isn't reduced.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher, a creature that fails its save takes an additional {@damage 1d8} cold damage and has its speed reduced by an additional 10 feet for each spell level above 2nd.

spell.name: Chromatic Blade
entries: You evoke an elemental blade in a free hand, choosing one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder. The elemental blade appears as if it were made of the chosen element, and lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action without expending a spell slot.

Whenever you would make a melee attack, you can make a melee spell attack with the elemental blade against a target within your reach. On hit, it takes damage of the type you chose upon casting equal to {@damage 2d6} + your spellcasting modifier.
While in your hand, your elemental blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for every two slot levels above 2nd.

spell.name: Corrosive Bolt

components.m: the skin of a poisonous snake

entries: You conjure a spear of caustic acid and make a ranged spell attack against a creature or object you can see within range. On hit, your target takes {@damage 4d10} acid damage and its Armor Class is reduced by 2. This spell cannot cause a creature to have an Armor Class lower then 10.
A creature can use an action to scrape the acid from this spell off the target, returning its Armor Class to normal.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d10} and it further reduces the target's Armor Class by 1 for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Sonic Wave
entries: You forcefully clasp your hands and shockwave of booming force shoots forth from you and emits a boom audible out to 500 feet. All creatures in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 4d8} thunder damage, fall {@condition prone}, and be {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a success, they take half damage and is not knocked {@condition prone} or {@condition deafened}.
A creature can repeat this saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8}, and the cone increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Spectral Passage

components.m: an object a spirit has passed through

entries: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, it becomes semi-incorporeal and can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. If the creature ends its movement inside another object or creature, it is immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space, taking {@damage 1d10} force damage for every 5 feet it was forced to travel.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th-level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

spell.name: Accursed Touch
entries: You attempt to transmute a creature into stone. As an action, you touch a creature, forcing it to make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition restrained} as its flesh begins to harden. On a successful save, it isn't affected.

A creature {@condition restrained} by this spell must make another Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If it successfully saves against this spell three times, the spell ends. If it fails three saves, it is turned to stone and {@condition petrified}. The successes and failures don't need to be consecutive; keep track of both until the creature fails or passes three saves.
If the creature is physically broken while {@condition petrified}, it suffers from similar deformities if it reverts to its original state.
If you maintain your {@status concentration} for the entire duration, the creature is turned to stone until the effect is removed.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the number of saves it must fail before it is {@condition petrified} is reduced by 1 (to a minimum of 1) for each level above 4th.
